Line 23: Line 23:
A sexual act with a corpse is generally considered socially unacceptable; the presumption being that the person would not have consented to the act while alive, it amounts to the [[rape]] of a dead body. Virtually all human [[society | societies]] condemn abuse of the dead. However, in rare cases, necrophiliac acts can be consensual: for example, in the [[Armin Meiwes]] case, the victim gave his consent to the mutilation and death inflicted upon him.
A sexual act with a corpse is generally considered socially unacceptable; the presumption being that the person would not have consented to the act while alive, it amounts to the [[rape]] of a dead body. Virtually all human [[society | societies]] condemn abuse of the dead. However, in rare cases, necrophiliac acts can be consensual: for example, in the [[Armin Meiwes]] case, the victim gave his consent to the mutilation and death inflicted upon him.

== necrophilia in the arts ==
+
== Necrophilia in the arts ==
Necrophilia has at times been employed as a subject matter in films, novels, music ect... The controversial German film ''[[Nekromantik]]'' deals graphically with the subject, also the [[Canadian]] film ''Kissed'' is about a woman who works in a morgue and finds herself erotically drawn to the corpses she deals with. In the 1970's, shock rocker [[Alice Cooper]] recorded a couple of songs about necrophilia, one entitled "I love the dead", and the other called "Cold ethyl". In the 80's and 90's necrophilia was often a subject of songs in the [[death metal]] and [[black metal]] genres. In the [[1993]] music video for [[Tom Petty]]'s hit song "Last dance with Mary-Jane" Petty is seen in various romantic poses with a dead woman (played by [[Kim Bassinger]]).
